intro: Tithymalus dracunculoides subsp. hesperius, commonly known as the western tithymalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is native to western North America, particularly in regions of California and Oregon. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
